lines.text: Everybody'd be nice to you if they knew you were dying.
Everybody knows everybody is dying; that's why people are as good as they are.
Skip the facts, just gimme the details.
[last lines]
From here on in, I rag nobody.
Oh Katie, honey, why don't you get yourself married and raise yourself some exemptions.
See, it was no double birdie.
Double Birdie?
Whereas for, it coulda been a spread eagle.

Probably you've been playing Southeastern Tegwar all your life, but in the Majors the boys all play Western Canadian style. Which, for my money, is much faster. That leaves you free for a Butchered Hog most any time, whereas, uh.
Whereas uh.
Wh, Whereas what?
Whereas, it, uh, keeps you from dropping dead on the board.
These are Fifth and Two. Fifth and Queen.
Red Rooster.
[long pause, then Tegawar Player lays a 3. Joe slams down his cards]
BANJO! Ha-HAAAA! That's the first natural Banjo since the days of Joe Dimaggio in St. Petersburg.
Hey, wait a minute. Fifteen and Fifteen's Thirty-One.
Hey, what's the name of this game?
Fifteen and Fifteen is Thirty-TWO!
Thirry-T... oh, that's right.
[to Tegwar player]
That's a Double Honeybees.
I'm not too sure if I'm clear on some of these new rules.
What new rules? There hasn't been any rules changes since the Black Sox Scandal, 1919. Big League Tegwar's Big League Tegwar known to every big-time ballplayer from Boston to California.
Can you beat a Coney Island Thirty?
What about this Double Ace Deucer?
I wish ya a lot of luck with it.

[taking Piney's revolver in the locker room]
Hand it over. I'm in no mood to see anybody get killed by a buller wound. Piney, I hear you have bullets with it too.
Yes, sir. They're in the gun.
Why the hell didn't you tell me?
I didn't think it'd go off. I'm always very careful.
That's what everybody says. That's why the hospital's full of babies.
